doc.field: New-York Historical Society collection of caricatures and cartoons
New-York Historical Society collection of caricatures and cartoons

No title. [Grover Cleveland stoops to pick up coin bearing inscription "Tariff Reform 1892". Tammany tiger affectionately rubs against him. In the background is seated figure of Uncle Sam and an unidentified figure preceded by a hastily retreating elephant. Sign reads "Direct road to Salt River. Boats to let."]

No title. [Grover Cleveland stoops to pick up coin bearing inscription "Tariff Reform 1892". Tammany tiger affectionately rubs against him. In the background is seated figure of Uncle Sam and an unidentified figure preceded by a hastily retreating elephant. Sign reads "Direct road to Salt River. Boats to let."]
Pen drawing. Signed C.G.B-[ush]. Cleveland Wins (in pencil). Acquisition(?) date on front: June 21, 1905.
New-York Historical Society collection of caricatures and cartoons
